intro: Calandrinia corymbosa, commonly known as the "pink rock rose," is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Calandrinia corymbosa is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
